[@isto.e.lixo] Praia da Tocha is a port for large quantities of "catraia" (trash that goes to the coast) which has polluted the sand and dunes.  Collecting all this trash and recycling it is undoubtedly a good option. However, even more, it is important to reuse it so that new and unnecessary waste is not created. The Lixophone is a musical instrument that takes advantage of new technologies to give a new life to the old "catraia" of Praia da Tocha - the trash is not dead!  Old logs, ropes and plastics serve as a structure; old air-filled bottles are properly tuned to become musical agents; finally, by means of electric motors and microcontrollers, this Frankenstein instrument takes on a life of its own playing music autonomously. Come to visit it until Sunday, 30th August 2020 in Praia da Tocha, Portugal. A project in collaboration with Gabriel Salvador (@isto.e.lixo) for @catraia_. Thank you very much to all the contributers and visitors! Thank you very much @thetrashtraveler for your work on making people aware of the urgency to stop plastics, and thanks you so much for supporting Lixofone! See you soon! Best wishes! #trash #music #technology #instrument #robot #instalation #reuze #collect #clean #responsable #environment #sea #beach #arduino #lixo #praia #praiadatocha #coimbra #portugal #notoplastics

Proposal for outdoor three dimensional signage for DEI (Department of Informatics Engineering, University of Coimbra). The glyphs were designed out of their binary representation, using filled and void squares (pixels). In collaboration with @pedronunosilva22

Posters for the rebranding of DEI. The glyphs were designed out of their binary representation, using filled and void squares (pixels). The bars show up a grid marked by the 1s in the binary version of "DEI". In collaboration with @pedronunosilva22.

"Bolor" ("mold", like moldy bread) reflects about time and degradation. As a metaphor, the cover is illustrated in a simple and direct way using moldy breads and an alarm clock, so one may wake up and listen to this message.

Spoon" is an album inspired by the poem  "The Spoon" by Richard Jones, reflecting about the endless functionalities one may give to a spoon is one let the imagination to fly. As a consequence, one may reflect on the superfluous objects we live around with.

The album "Bass" is a homage to the bass guitar, exploring its sound textures and taking advantage of its groovy and funky capabilities. Same way, groovy and funky graphics illustrate this cover.

#graphicdesign #graphic #design #album #cover #vynil #boss #coimbra #portugal @theptdesign @design.feed @aigadesign @diariograficopt @vieworkpt @designadvisorpt @graphic_design_feed @anothergraphicdotorg @collectgraphics

One may reflect on the behaviour of a dog — the Man's best friend. Is it for friendship or rather for getting something in return? Is it good or is it bad? Isn't every relation to getting something in return (giving and taking)? This dog called "Chefe" (Boss) may be referred to as an inspiring muse. For that reason, the space of this cover was dedicated to it.

The creation of an interactive brand for the hairdresser Ted Gibson @tedgibson (speculative proposal). The generative logotype is made of vertical hairs created with Processing. Using a camera and a natively developed computer vision algorithm, the hairs may be brushed or cut accordingly to the movement ahead. DERIVAS — [AQUI] É UM BOM LUGAR: 12 e 14 de Outubro, das 10h às 13h, Coimbra INSCRIÇÃO GRATUITA 

https://fb.me/e/1c729uV9h

Caminhadas que são gestos de hospitalidade para com os novos habitantes da cidade. Quem vive e conhece (bem) Coimbra, recebe e partilha com os recém chegados a ‘sua’ cidade.

12 OUTUBRO — CULTURA + VERDE
(Opcionalmente, podes trazer a tua marmita para almoçar no final da visita)
1. Praça da República / TAGV (Ponto de encontro)
2. Jardim da Sereia
3. CAPC Sereia
4. Casa da Esquina
5. Jardim  Botânico 
6. Parque Verde
7. Margem de Santa Clara

14 OUTUBRO — ENTRE A ALTA E A BAIXA
1. Museu Nacional de Machado de Castro (Ponto de encontro)
2. Museu da Ciência da Universidade de Coimbra
3. Salão Brazil
4. Mercado D. Pedro V
5. Café Santa Cruz

Organização: Cria'ctividade + @habaixa. Parceiros: Casa da Esquina, Círculo de Artes Plásticas de Coimbra, Museu Nacional de Machado de Castro, Museu da Ciência da Universidade de Coimbra, Jardim Botânico da Universidade de Coimbra,  Jazz ao Centro Clube / Salao Brazil

Lotação máxima: 10 pessoas por dia.Uso obrigatório de máscara de protecção e cumprimento da distância de segurança.

Information visualization of artist's gender in moma's exhibitions @themuseumofmodernart . Root programmed website. Each rectagle represents an exhibition, placed in the timeline with beginning and ending dates. IA searching algorithm handles the vertical position of the rectangles to puzzle them together in the right date with no overlaying. Color stands for gender. Information dynamicaly taken from dataworld (updates at the time the database does). Speculative project.
